definition: livelihood
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: Many people who lost their jobs during the Great Depression had to do whatever they could.
sentences.chinese: 许多人在大萧条中失去工作，迫于生计，无所不为。

sentences.english: Antinori's determination to clone threatens his current livelihood.
sentences.chinese: 安蒂诺里坚持克隆人的决心已危及到他目前的生计。

sentences.english: The drought also posed a threat to the immediate future of thousands of smallholder farmers.
sentences.chinese: 干旱还威胁着成千上万小农近期的生计。

sentences.english: Overnight, they were forcibly deprived of their living.
sentences.chinese: 一夜之间，他们的生计被强制剥夺了。

sentences.english: We aim at the assurance of a rounded, a permanent national life.
sentences.chinese: 我们务使国民生计获得全面和长久的保证。

sentences.english: Do you think he can or should be further on top career-wise?
sentences.chinese: 还是你以为他应当在任业生活生计上再进一步？

sentences.english: He learned from folk artists and sculptors how to make a living.
sentences.chinese: 生活贫困，为了生计，他向民间画工和雕匠学习。

sentences.english: Female domestic workers usually seek work abroad out of desperation .
sentences.chinese: 女性家庭帮佣往往因生计困难而出国找工作。

sentences.english: An interest in child rights, education, health, gender, livelihoods is appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 对儿童权利，教育，健康，性别，生计感兴趣者为佳。

sentences.english: Most of marketing people persuade non-necessary needs of the people for their living.
sentences.chinese: 大多的销售为了他们的生计向别人推销不需要的东西。

sentences.english: There's not al a rge enough base of workers to support them.
sentences.chinese: 现在的工人的基数不够大，不足以维持他们的生计。

sentences.english: One night I had a nightmare, running whole night for unobtainable thing. I made a decision when I was awoken.
sentences.chinese: 前夜作了一个奔波生计的梦，醒来后暗暗地决定。

sentences.english: What do you do for a living?
Our toil, resources, and livelihood are all involved.
sentences.chinese: 我们的辛劳，资源和生计全部生计都命悬于此。

sentences.english: Our toil, resources, and livelihood are all involved.
sentences.chinese: 我们的辛劳，资源和生计全部生计都命悬于此。

sentences.english: We have to form longer-term plans for helping people to recover .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须制定帮助人们恢复生计的长期计划。

definition: to scrape a meager living/to get by with difficulty
variant of 糊口[hu2 kou3]
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to support one's family (idiom)
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
to earn a living
(coll.) job/work
to subsist/to eke out a living/to keep body and soul together
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to pass one's days/to scratch out a difficult, meager existence
no way to get by
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
temporary job/odd job
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
